title: "Do The RIGHT Thing"
body_text:
DODGEBALL 129 Results
First-Half of the Season 13 Double Main Event!
Your classic, five-star, back bourt brawl? Not a chance in hell on this 8th of March. With the wind ferociously blowing and the bright lights failing to power on,
EastCoastDodgeball's
presentation of its 129th extravaganza reverted back to the previous year - it was
dark
and and it was cold, and those captured seeked their freedom!
Prison Ball
, competed under the measly street light that practically salvaged the sport from termination in late-2006, was back. The prodigy generals - 2007
ROOKIE of the Year
candidate
Rob Pellecchia
and 2008's fastest rising headliner
Bobby Vetrano
- mentally psyched and physically prepared to just kick some ass!
Flash Results by Game
Vetrano: 1
Pellecchia: 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7
Vetrano overcame enemy forces in the first of seven free-for-all rounds, but once Pellecchia gained possession of the match, it was all she wrote for 2008's rookie sensation.
The entire 13th Season has been damn unlucky for just about all of the losing participants, captains especially. Beginning with the Butler-Butler clash from DODGEBALL 121, not a single contest during the course of the past nine weeks has concluded with a point spread less than two.
In one of of the year's most physically grueling encounters, Rob Pellecchia defeated BoBby Vetrano, 6 crushing games to 1.
And because of the unusual weather-related circumstances surrounding this confrontation, both warriors have already figuratively signed the rematch contract. Expect that mega-match in the coming months.
Moments & Stars
: Kevin Fitzpatrick's incredible string of catches throughout 129; an imprisoned John Tronolone receiving a nutshot from ally Chris Adams; Bobby Vetrano feeling the effects of a Fitzpatrick-thrown bulletball;
Eat Up! - Birthday Fun at 129!
DODGEBALL 129 played host to a small birthday celebration for legend Chris Adams and Justin Pierce. While Lauren Stopa organized the gathering, others chipped in a few bucks to buy a delicious Costco cake. Captain Pellecchia's generosity also goes noticed having brought a gigantic [and seemingly unbreakable] chocolate heart.
RECORDS
Attendance:
17
(13 men, 4 women)
Notable Return: Bobby Bonney (previous DB 118)
- This 129th will long be remembered as one of, if not the windiest event in history. It is believed that the wild weather may have even caused the large tennis to fail, which is why play reverted back to the Front Courts for the first time since DODGEBALL 88*.
Dark Dodgeball
and
Prison Ball
returned as well.
- DODGEBALL 129 featured the birthday celebrations for legend Justin Pierce and Chris Adams.
- Rob Pellecchia defeated Bobby Vetrano 6 games to 1. This was the first time either competitor was captain.
*DODGEBALL 88 was the last event played entirely on the front courts where as DODGEBALL 105 witnessed the single-game tie-breaker between C. Adams and Fitzpatrick.
body_html:
DODGEBALL 129 Results
First-Half of the Season 13 Double Main Event!

Your classic, five-star, back bourt brawl? Not a chance in hell on this 8th of March. With the wind ferociously blowing and the bright lights failing to power on, EastCoastDodgeball's presentation of its 129th extravaganza reverted back to the previous year - it was dark and and it was cold, and those captured seeked their freedom!

Prison Ball, competed under the measly street light that practically salvaged the sport from termination in late-2006, was back. The prodigy generals - 2007 ROOKIE of the Year candidate Rob Pellecchia and 2008's fastest rising headliner Bobby Vetrano - mentally psyched and physically prepared to just kick some ass!

Flash Results by Game
Vetrano: 1
Pellecchia: 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7

Vetrano overcame enemy forces in the first of seven free-for-all rounds, but once Pellecchia gained possession of the match, it was all she wrote for 2008's rookie sensation.

The entire 13th Season has been damn unlucky for just about all of the losing participants, captains especially. Beginning with the Butler-Butler clash from DODGEBALL 121, not a single contest during the course of the past nine weeks has concluded with a point spread less than two.

In one of of the year's most physically grueling encounters, Rob Pellecchia defeated BoBby Vetrano, 6 crushing games to 1.

And because of the unusual weather-related circumstances surrounding this confrontation, both warriors have already figuratively signed the rematch contract. Expect that mega-match in the coming months.

Moments & Stars: Kevin Fitzpatrick's incredible string of catches throughout 129; an imprisoned John Tronolone receiving a nutshot from ally Chris Adams; Bobby Vetrano feeling the effects of a Fitzpatrick-thrown bulletball;

Eat Up! - Birthday Fun at 129!
DODGEBALL 129 played host to a small birthday celebration for legend Chris Adams and Justin Pierce. While Lauren Stopa organized the gathering, others chipped in a few bucks to buy a delicious Costco cake. Captain Pellecchia's generosity also goes noticed having brought a gigantic [and seemingly unbreakable] chocolate heart.

RECORDS
Attendance: 17 (13 men, 4 women)
Notable Return: Bobby Bonney (previous DB 118)

- This 129th will long be remembered as one of, if not the windiest event in history. It is believed that the wild weather may have even caused the large tennis to fail, which is why play reverted back to the Front Courts for the first time since DODGEBALL 88*. Dark Dodgeball and Prison Ball returned as well.
- DODGEBALL 129 featured the birthday celebrations for legend Justin Pierce and Chris Adams.
- Rob Pellecchia defeated Bobby Vetrano 6 games to 1. This was the first time either competitor was captain.

*DODGEBALL 88 was the last event played entirely on the front courts where as DODGEBALL 105 witnessed the single-game tie-breaker between C. Adams and Fitzpatrick.
